name: calemes
params: setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

body.origin:
|- wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, w2))
-| wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, w2))
-| wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w2)))

stmt.origin: ax-mp(wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w2))), wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w0))))

body.origin:
|- wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w2)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w0)))
-| wi(wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w0))), wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w2))))

cumulated.origin:
|- wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, w2))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w0)))
-| wi(wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w0))), wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w2))))

body.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w0))), wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w2))))
-| wi(wi(w2, wn(w0)), wi(w0, wn(w2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, w2))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w0)))
-| wi(wi(w2, wn(w0)), wi(w0, wn(w2)))

|- wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, w2))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w0)))

comment: "Calemes", one of the syllogisms of Aristotelian logic. All ` ph ` is ` ps ` , and no ` ps ` is ` ch ` , therefore no ` ch ` is ` ph ` . In Aristotelian notation, AEE-4: PaM and MeS therefore SeP. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 28-Aug-2016.) Reduce dependencies on axioms. (Revised by BJ, 16-Sep-2022.)
